meanings.definition: The ability to see, hear, or become aware of something through the senses.
meanings.sent1: Her perception of the world was clear and bright.
meanings.sent2: His perception of the music was that it was too loud.
meanings.sent3: The cat's perception of the vacuum cleaner was comical as it pounced on it playfully.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, his perception of time slowed to a crawl.
meanings.sent5: The artist's perception of color was so vivid that it seemed to jump off the canvas.

meanings.definition: The way in which something is regarded, understood, or interpreted.
meanings.sent1: The perception of the situation varied among the group.
meanings.sent2: Her perception of the book was that it was a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent3: His perception of the joke was so literal that he missed the humor entirely.
meanings.sent4: The perception of time as a river flowing steadily is a common metaphor.
meanings.sent5: The child's perception of the monster under the bed made bedtime a challenge.

meanings.definition: A mental impression or understanding of something.
meanings.sent1: His perception of the concept was clear after the explanation.
meanings.sent2: The perception of danger lingered in her mind long after the incident.
meanings.sent3: The dog's perception of the treat made it wag its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: Time's perception as a thief stealing moments is a poignant thought.
meanings.sent5: The perception of success drove her to work harder towards her goals.
